misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm.
description: The use of MD5 as a cryptographic hash function is considered insecure and should not be used for secure applications. It has been shown to be vulnerable to collisions, which can lead to attacks such as hash flooding and collision attacks.
recommendation: Use a secure and modern cryptographic hash function such as SHA-2 or SHA-3 instead of MD5.
